content: the watermelon is constructed by working 1 the foundation row of the rind in black green and white and then 2 the red flesh after completing the row necessary to achieve the desired length in the foundation row stitches are worked in short row across to create the curve edges are finished with a single_crochet to prevent curling seeds can be sewn with black thread/yarn as desired this pattern includes a chart yarn this top was designed using knitting for olive s pure silk a fingering weight yarn the approximate amounts required 24g of blood orange 4 7g of coal 2 8g of olive 1 4g of putty you can use any yarn of any weight but please adjust the hook and number of cast on stitches for desired size hooks tunisian crochet hook size 5mm with wire with the recommended yarn crochet hook 2 5 skill level as it is tss it is fairly simple and achievable for a beginner some familiarity with short row would be helpful **nb when working the short row please work the last stitch as you would a normal edge stitch ** and yes the sewn is a play on words
